item.title: How do i change what the char wear when they first start?
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

Try this -

playerEquipment[playerHat] == 6623; playerEquipment[playerCape] == Item.randomCape(); playerEquipment[playerAmulet] == Item.randomAmulet(); playerEquipment[playerChest] == 6617; playerEquipment[playerShield] == Item.randomShield(); playerEquipment[playerLegs] == 6625; playerEquipment[playerHands] == 6629; playerEquipment[playerFeet] == 6619; playerEquipment[playerRing] == Item.randomRing(); playerEquipment[playerArrows] == Item.randomArrows(); playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == 6609;
Reply if there are errors.

Read full topic

item.title: How do i change what the char wear when they first start?
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

[quote=“Setsuna, post:14, topic:261990”]Me and the person who made this need to know how to change what people start with, does this have anything to do with it? (In player.java Testscape source)

//Giving the player an unique look
playerEquipment[playerHat]=Item.randomHat();
playerEquipment[playerCape]=Item.randomCape();
playerEquipment[playerAmulet]=Item.randomAmulet();
playerEquipment[playerChest]=Item.randomBody();
playerEquipment[playerShield]=Item.randomShield();
playerEquipment[playerLegs]=Item.randomLegs();
playerEquipment[playerHands]=Item.randomGloves();
playerEquipment[playerFeet]=Item.randomBoots();
playerEquipment[playerRing]=Item.randomRing();
playerEquipment[playerArrows]=Item.randomArrows();
playerEquipment[playerWeapon]=1275;[/quote]
As you can see, after each one, it says Item.random.
This means that the player will get a random item equipped to that slot.
To make it what you want, just change what is after the equal sign to an item ID.

//Giving the player an unique look playerEquipment[playerHat]=####; playerEquipment[playerCape]=####; playerEquipment[playerAmulet]=####; playerEquipment[playerChest]=####; playerEquipment[playerShield]=####; playerEquipment[playerLegs]=####; playerEquipment[playerHands]=####; playerEquipment[playerFeet]=####; playerEquipment[playerRing]=####; playerEquipment[playerArrows]=####; playerEquipment[playerWeapon]=####;
Just change all of those ####'s to the item ID you want.
If you want nothing to be in those slots, just type -1 as the item ID.
Hope you understand; reply with errors!

Read full topic
item.source: How do i change what the char wear when they first start?

item.title: How do i change what the char wear when they first start?
item.dc:creator: @Setsuna Setsuna
item.description:
@Setsuna wrote:

Me and the person who made this need to know how to change what people start with, does this have anything to do with it? (In player.java Testscape source)

//Giving the player an unique look
playerEquipment[playerHat]=Item.randomHat();
playerEquipment[playerCape]=Item.randomCape();
playerEquipment[playerAmulet]=Item.randomAmulet();
playerEquipment[playerChest]=Item.randomBody();
playerEquipment[playerShield]=Item.randomShield();
playerEquipment[playerLegs]=Item.randomLegs();
playerEquipment[playerHands]=Item.randomGloves();
playerEquipment[playerFeet]=Item.randomBoots();
playerEquipment[playerRing]=Item.randomRing();
playerEquipment[playerArrows]=Item.randomArrows();
playerEquipment[playerWeapon]=1275;
